OFFERING
NAEB RADIO NETWORK
August 8, 1955
OFFERING
Series #-38 (Fall 19#)
Title: THE BRIDE OF LAMMERMOOR
Type: Drama (Serial)
Time: 30 minutes
No,: 8 episodes
Origin: BBC
Audience: Gene ral
Release: Issue #U5 (Nov. 6)
Since the first five programs in the series THE BBC THEATRE run up to an hour
and a half and the last eight run only an hour, this eight-episode serial was se¬
lected to fill in the difference in time after the first five BBC THEATRE programs.
It is suggested that you may wish to work this serial into your schedule accordingly;
This most tragic of Sir Walter Scott*s romances — on which Donizett*s opera
"Lucia di Lammermoor" is based — has been adapted for radio by R, J. B. Sellar,
Set in East Lothian near the sea about the year 1695, the theme of the story is the
unfolding of an ancient prophecy concerning the last Laird of Ravenswood. Edgar,
Master of Ravenswood, the last representative of a family dispossessed because of
their part in the rebellion against the government, falls in love with Lucy Ashton,
the daughter of his ancestral enemy who now owns the Ravenswood estates. For a
while they glimpse hope and happiness, but the ambitious Lady Ashton opposes the
match, and the romance closes in death and sorrow.
Date of expiry: January 16, 1957.
The tape recordings should be returned to, or traded with, the NAEB Radio Net¬
work (NOT BBC).
